alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Kanawha; Lewis; Ritchie; Roane; Tyler; Upshur; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 9:13AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, northeastern Kanawha, northwestern Upshur, eastern Wirt, Roane, west central Barbour, Harrison, Ritchie, Doddridge, Gilmer, Lewis, Braxton, southeastern Tyler and northern Clay Counties through 1000 AM EDT... At 912 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near North Bend State Park to near Grantsville to near Elkview. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain that could create localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains may lead to rises on creeks and streams and create ponding of water in low lying spots. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Weston, Spencer, Harrisville, Glenville, Sutton, Grantsville, Bridgeport, Shinnston, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Salem, Clendenin, Pennsboro, Gassaway, Lumberport, West Union, Anmoore, Arnoldsburg and Cedar Creek State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 8 and 123. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 27 and 28, and between mile markers 30 and 82. Route 19 near mile marker 68. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Flash Flood Watch remains in effect. Heavy downpours could cause rapid rises in water. If rising water is observed, move to higher ground. Do not drive into areas covered by water. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Doddridge; Gilmer; Harrison; Kanawha; Lewis; Ritchie; Roane; Tyler; Upshur; Wirt
